abstract.p: William C Trier letter notes that Vicki Goldberg's August 13 article on Baron Wilhelm von Gloeden photography shows Sicilian Youth With Amphora depicts youth with condition called gynecomastia, or breast enlargement (S)

block.p: It is interesting that the photograph ''Sicilian Youth With Amphora,'' which accompanied the article ''A Man-Made Arcadia Enshrining Male Beauty'' by Vicki Goldberg [Aug. 13], depicts a youth with gynecomastia, a condition in which pubertal boys or men develop breast enlargement of varying degrees. The breasts resemble those of females; young men or mature men may seek correction by plastic surgeons to remove a source of embarrrassment and ridicule. What strikes me is that Baron Wilhelm von Gloeden would have chosen this particular subject to photograph -- unless it is a young female, or the photographer was choosing to be cleverly humorous.
